I enjoy this game overall. It can be fun to play but some of the bugs and issues do take away from this enjoyment. If the matchmaking system is fixed, then I will probably enjoy it a lot more. 

Its not very fun to be a rank 20 survivor, playing against a rank 1 killer. Noris it fun to play as a rank 20, level 1 killer against rank 1 survivors. The lag issue is also a problem. It would be nice if there was a display of the servers ping so that survivors could be avare of what they are getting into.

But, overall I do enjoy playing this game, I just hope some of those issues get fixed.
The game is very fun.
this game is so fun i highly reccomend it to your firnds cause it was the nest 20 dollars i ever spent

Game near impossible to play killer at low level.  Every game I get into game enemy team has at least 3 saboteur team spends entire first 5 minutes breaking every hook, and of course iron grasp perk is no where in sight still at level 10 trapper.  They need to highlight the hooks on the map at all times and ping when one is broken at the very least.  I've played multiple games that I've had 3 of the 4 players downed and they just crawl to the exit because if I pick them up they just wiggle free before i make it to the basement.  This game was great but current sabotage method kills it for me.  Not to mention how awful the useless matchmaking is..... I still recommend the game just don't play killer until you have iron grasp

Das Spiel ist an sich ziemlich gut, aber das Spiel hat viele Bugs, dadurch kann man mal schnell Ranks verlieren, wenn sie dies beheben k√∂nnten, w√§re es super, ansonsten ist das Spiel Top ! :P

Llevo a√±os jugando DBD, pero desde que metieron el ultimo parche han destruido todo el juego, ahora solo hay SV pegados en los generadores con recambios, ExtraOficial, Demuestra lo que Vales y Astringente, por si fuera poco siempre toca Premades con Linternas, las cuales llevan Macro y no dejan de cegarte hagas lo que hagas, los Killers ahora est√°n muy fuertes dicen, pero su haces 1K puede ser hasta un milagro ya que solo ves a los SV en las puertas, preparaditos para el T-BAG, en serio.
Antes el juego te daba la oportunidad de perseguir, pero ahora? un autentico infierno.

Por el lado del SV, el Killer solo mata de dos formas, campeando o tuneleando, para los que jugamos con un poquito de moral de Killer no jugamos as√≠, pero si quieres ganar de Killer, no te va a quedar otra, y sobretodo, si quieres subir tus PJ con BP buena suerte, porque ni en broma podr√°s subirlo ni con 1 mill√≥n como antiguamente.

Antes el juego estaba roto y aun as√≠ le di una rese√±a positiva, pero es que ahora esta totalmente destrozado, es casi imposible frenar los generadores, eso si un Nurse, un Deterioro y una Esp√≠ritu puede alegrarte el d√≠a, es lo √∫nico que encontraras ahora de Killer tal como esta el meta y no quieres quedar con cara de bobo mientras te hacen T-Bag en la puerta.

Desinstalado para siempre o hasta que hagan cambios realmente equilibrados y justos, mientras jugare a VHS o similar, DBD ya no es el √∫nico juego.

- Two of us left, I am injured
- Using the bond perk notice that the other teammate is hiding in a closet by the hatch
- Teammate is waiting for me to die so he can escape
- Spam the enter closet button hoping killer sees
- Killer knocks me out
- Killer opens closet and takes guy out
- Killer hangs guy on hook
- Guy dies
- I start spinning in circles on the floor
- Killer picks me up
- Killer carries me to hatch
- I escape

10/10 would rat out campers again

This game is a good idea executed very poorly. Its such a shame because it can be so fun, but when the survivor meta involves running around in circles all day to stall the killer the game just gets reduced to this dogshit game of redundancy. For real all I do all day as a killer is run in circles trying to get JUST ONE HOOK and meanwhile one gen is already done and another one is probably more then halfway done. To put this into perspective: Killer needs to hook each survivor 3 times total to kill them with 3 more of them you need a total of 12 hooks to kill all of them. If I need to get 12 hooks and they need to finish only 5 gens to win you would think it would be very hard to do a gen. Nope super EZ to finish a gen even with only one survivor. This game has some MAJOR balance issues that need to be addressed, and I would not recommend it. Honestly astounding to me how this game has a mostly positive rating.

i liked this game for about 20 minutes and then it started crashing on me, every 5 mins it would just close so i would have to restart the game. it is fun at first and would be without these problems so for now i wouldnt recommend and im afraid im going to request a refund!

it's a very good game

Fantastic game.  Survival horror at it's best.

Be a survivor.  Get hunted by a madman with a chainsaw while you are desperately trying to escape his sadistic prison.

Be a killer.  Don't let them escape.  Your dark god is hungry and you need to feed it.  Hunt them down and show them fear.

If you like slasher films, lovecraft and survival horror, buy this game.

Over 3,000 hours later, I believe I can safely say that this is most certainly a game worth buying and a developer worth supporting.  The developers are extremely transparent with their patches and future plans and are clearly learning from past mistakes and very much so improving as a company with their game. 

The game itself is fantastic, if I say so myself. The core gameplay loop can almost feel repetitive, but the progression and nearly perfect level of content keep it somehow feeling fresh again. The regular 3-month updates always bring something new, be it new characters, maps, perks, or simply bug fixes, help keep the game refreshing and bringing you back. The progression system feels meaningful with just the right amount of grind and reward while the ranking system is certainly interesting(/s). Also plenty of content, but not an overwhelming amount.

The community, however, can be fairly toxic. Steam forums typically being worst, but messages in the end-game chat can be fairly wild.

I've bought this game for at least 10 friends so far, go buy it already!
Good game with a lot of crybabies.
It's trash

Oft fliegt man einfach wieder direkt raus. 

Desweiteren habe ich das Rangsystem zu bemengeln, da es einfach dumm umgesetzt ist, so bald ein "Stranger" quittet kann man die 10000 Punkte schon fast gar nicht mehr erreichen, somit verliert man wieder einen Rangpunkt.

Hinter dem Spiel steckt ein tolles Konzept, nur leider schlecht umgesetzt. Der Preis ist eine Frechheit, im aktuellen Zustand des Spiels ist es h√∂chstens 5‚Ç¨ wert. 

Auch die diversen Patches zeigten bisher nur wenig positives Ver√§nderung.

Unbedingt behoben werden muss auch das der Killer nicht non-stop vor dem Haken campt.

Ich w√ºrde das Spiel einstufen auf Early-Access, denn dieses Game braucht noch lange bis es fertig ist.

Looking forward to more improvements to come (and hoping for no more major screw ups!)

so at first i thought this would be something i could sink my teeth into. A game about a killer hunting down surviors. 4v1..randomly generated maps...man all this sounds fun. But it is ruined by a toxic 
community...constant bugs and connection errors...and much more. so what sounds like fun on paper...in actual practice and gameplay ends up being a mess.Given more time and effort im sure if can be smoothed out and polished.But as it stands right now...its just not worth the price of admission....cant really recommend this.THANK GOD for steam refunds!!! If you want a 4v1 go download evolve. Its free and a lot more fun.

This is currently my favorite game on Steam.

The idea behind the game is simple enough. There's a nutso killer, 4 survivors, and you're one or the other. The killer chases people, tries to stop them from escaping, and hangs them on hooks to let a freaky satan spider rise up from the ground and kill them. 

The complexity and replayability is found in the level-up system. For each 4 playable survivors and 3 playable killers (as of patch 1.0.5), there are 50 levels for each 3 prestiges, meaning a total of 200 levels for each of the 7 characters. Also, once you reach level 50, you can keep spending points on the player to get more stuff if that's what you're into.

You'll notice pretty quickly when you get this game that people complain on the Steam discussions page and complain a lot. Most of the trouble comes from the misperceptions about the way the balance is supposed to work. It is an asymmetrical game, meaning that the killer has to be inherently more powerful than survivors. Strength in numbers is the best natural advantage survivors have, and making use of that is vital.

The game is hard. You'll likely suck at the beginning. But learning not to suck is an expereience and a journey that makes this game worth any and all frustration undergone.

They fucked it up 4 years later.

Balancing for new players and removing mechanics that made matches last longer. When survivors are no longer new they have an easy time to win against killers at any rank, even if they cannot loop, as long as they do generators. Playing killer is on a very short clock before all gens are done, and is only frustrating to play now, with little to no room to play with your food or in general any survivor & killer interaction. Matches where a survivor does not even see the killer occur more than ever now.

Developers cater to these players so they can sell their cosmetics and dlcs to new players. The old players have already paid, get rid of them and get a new steady flow of newbies to rip off, until they reach the same conclusion and quit.

Just look at survivor queue times now. 

Enjoy queue simulator

The only issues in this game right now are:
1) Waiting times for survivors is unreal. Less people are playing Killers (for stupid reasons I'll debunk below).
2) There are still issues with Killer-Bots who are just scripted to stand in place and keep swinging their weapon. Sure, it's free and easy blood points; but it ruins the point of the game.
3) Human's online are just stupid. Like, literally, why would you start to heal me when the killer is coming at us?! (Please add a feature where we can shake off other survivors and run. Just make it a noise trigger for the killer to see).

- - - - -

Debunking some of the bad reviews:

- "The game favors surivors and playing killer is just a joke now! You can't win!"
>>> This is nonsense. This is literally just a cry from people who aren't as good of a killer as they think they are. Put on the right perks to make finding and handling survivors easier. Be more creative and strategic with the way you chase and capture. Think ahead. I've honestly had NO trouble as the killer; and I very rarely play the killer!

- "The survivors perks are over powered compared to the killers!"
>>> To a small extent I would agree; but not enough to where killing all of the survivors is hard, by any means. 
Self Heal: Stay on their tracks and they wont have time for it. 
Sabatour: Can be a massive issue, but at the pre-game screen you can SEE how many survivors might have this perk (or a toolbox). Adjust your perks so that once you catch them, you can take them to where YOU want to hang them (i.e. The Basement where they CAN'T undo hooks). And be more aggressive and relentless towards Jake's when you spot them.

- "Survivors aren't afraid of the killer anymore! They just toy with him and win!"
>>> Again, nonsense. It's true, there are survivors who try to 'Toy' with the killer by body blocking, instantly unhooking people while you're finishing your hooking animation, acting as a decoy, etc. But those survivors are the easiest to catch! They literally bring themselves TO YOU!
Body Blocking: Hit them while carrying your victim. It's not hard. It will get them out of your way. Duh.
Instant Unhooking: You have plenty of time to either 1) Hit the survivor they just took off the hook (and they'll sacrifice faster once you place them back on! GASP!) or 2) Get a hit on the cocky survivor. Chase either one of them down, and put them on the hook. They can only use that tactic like 2 times before they're instantly sacrificed when hooked. 
Decoy: They've PRESENTED themself to you. Accept the offering. If they're avoiding you in a troublesome area, leave them and search for the others. You'll either 1) Find a new survivor in a more favorable place for you. or 2) The decoy will follow you and likely be in a place more favorable for you. Just because someone's present before you doesn't mean they're the one you HAVE to go after, right at that moment. Think and stop being so simple minded.

- "The dev's don't listen to the community!"
>>> Most of the things you're crying about are personal 'Can't think for myself' problems. You have the solution to most problems as the killer. Adjust your perks and add-ons at the pre-game screen, think outside your simple 'Follow and Hit' methods, and put in actual effort. It's not hard catching survivors.

It was fun when the game first came out, I liked it better in its earlier phase.

But the more the changes, the worse my gameplay experience became.

There were some bugs removed (good ridance) but then it became killer buff city from then on.

What I loved in this game was this style of play, dealing with the unpredictable motives behind a serial killer is very enticing, and executed fairly decent for an indie game.

The graphics are good for what they are.

The gameplay is pretty solid for both sides of the coin which really fits.

What I hated.

Net codes or net in general when I play a game that I liked I shouldnt have tokeep dealing with cant find a match, cant join lobby. I spend atleast 5-15 minutes trying to find a match and then when I do theres a chance the killer rage quits.

Rank rewards and detractors
I like the rank aspect of the game you get to flash your skill with those amazing colors in the game which I love its funny but....not that great for me. I tampered with the files to see which rewards i get and well....they dont look all that great to me. The comsetics are just yucky and the blood looks better on the game then the characters. It was this is what made going for pips less and less enticing. 

It gets worse as the devs do punish qutting survivors by removing a pip and giving the killer points which is great and all but the killers doing the same they seem to get a free pass. The survivor isnt even rewarded on that aspect of the game.

The terrible net code and lag outs and lag deaths as well as Albert Wesker in my lobby really makes me want to play competetively less and less. WHich has lead to my own disconnections, both intentional and untintentional.

Killer bias's
As the patches grew so did the potency of the killers, they have recieved buffs and buffs, while the survivor gets jack squat.

Th removal of the "juking" was a huge mistake in my opinion as it added some mind games with the killer, because for one the killer moves faster than the survivor so...yeah I felt the juke was fair game for me. Unless killer mains cant handle mind games and want survivors to run in a straight line for a quick and easy kill SURE SURE...

They made the game much harder for the survivor by removing some hopping spots, which add more mind games for survivors to use against an obviously faster opponent.

The patches have been nothing more than feeding the killers game, both in and out the game.
They have better perks, better ways to catch hell when I played as the killer it was WAAAAAAAAAAAAY too easy to kill alot of players. TO a point of derp skill, there was a point where I missed players juking me, as i needed to use my brin and think on how to unwit them.

Also if a killer quits because a teem iz tu gud the survivors get punished for it (unless your in lvl 20 ception) than you have nothing to worry about.

Overall this game for me was good when it was released but these devs obviously hve dropped the ball numerous upon numerous times. With killer bia's, bad internet servers, and overall a bad package from what was a good 8-10
to 4-10.

So when they "update" the game in about half a year Ill give this another look, but for now ill either play like a moron from time to time. Derp quit cuz I can at this point or play something else.

It's a great game, although the connection (to the host/killer) can be terrible at times. 

One of the biggest problems I've seen in this game, is that sometimes the killer will not kill survivors, but rather befriend them and boost points with them. There should be a way to report this behavior.

And honestly, if you're a survivor and you boost with the killer, you're a nerd who cares more about your rank and points than you do about playing the game right.

Sur le fond, le jeu est bon.
Quelques bug encore ici et l√† mais l'ambiance est l√†, et les parties sont prenantes.
Par contre, quel ENORME probl√®me concernant le matchmaking! Je m'explique...

Si vous jouez seul, aucun souci. Vous trouverez des parties assez rapidement, que vous soyez survivant ou tueur.
Mais d√®s que vous souhaitez jouer avec des amis, et donc que vous √™tes 2 √† 4 joueurs group√©s, c'est du n'importe quoi.
Jusqu'√† 30 minutes d'attente pour trouver une partie. Oui oui, 30 minutes... Et pendant ces 30 minutes, il vous faudra appuyer toute les 10 secondes sur un bouton "Pr√™t". Oui parce que le jeu ne comprend pas que quand on demande une partie et que l'on est normalement constitu√©, 10 secondes plus tard, on souhaite toujours trouver une partie !

Alors messieurs les d√©veloppeurs, pour ma part c'est simple, jeu d√©sinstall√©.

Updated as of March 2020:

A game with a ton of potential for the genre but incredibly unbalanced towards Survivors to the point where people will not bother playing Killer because it simply isn't worth it.

Perks are good fun until you realise half of them are incredibly broken and make an already unbalanced game even worse.

The Killers are good fun and while they have perks which can compete, they aren't good enough to compete with a competent team.

Overall, I really enjoy this game, but to those thinking of playing it, try playing it with friends or just avoiding Killer altogether (unless you want to hang around the low to mid ranks in that case you can have some fun)
6.5/10

I liked this game before but now I gave up on it. Idea of the game is fine but there are 3 major flaws. 

1.My biggest issue is what a "pro" survivor for this game is. A "pro survivor" is a player that has a sprint boost and keeps circling the objects around a pallet until a killer finaly manages to catch up and then the survivor drops the pallet and goes for the next one. After you as a killer severly injure such survivor and grab him he uses another ability to fill up escape meter so you have to do the palet dance again. While doing this the rest of the team can get the generators easily but when you finaly manage to get 1 "pro player/palet dancer" then you are onto the next palet dance with the next player. This is the definition of a "pro" survivors. There are some killers that do wonders for palet dancing but I generaly don't like them. A pro player is basicaly little to do with skill but over 70% to do with perks.

2.Many times you will get survivors that play together while using voice chat. The game is kinda balanced for killer vs. 4 random survivors that have no real ability to communicate so voice chat does ruin the balance a lot.

3.The community has become very toxic. You are either a camper ( for chasing down a survivor going for the hooked buddy ), noob ( even when you have much more points that whoever called you noob ) or you get a silent treatment. On a few ocasions the survivors are nice but sadly its not that often.

I play games for fun and when you combine all these things together it becomes clear that this game is far from perfect since when playing against good survivors or doing the palet dancing with the right perks yourself as a survivor it becomes perfectly clear that this is not such a fun thing to play compared to the rest of the games in my library.

The game's atmosphere is very immersive when you begin playing the game, but the fear of being chased does lose its novalty to some degree. There are issues with bugs which are slowly being addressed with each patch, but don't be suprised about being hit by wild misses occasionally, or dropping a pallet and ending up on the wrong side. The rank system isn't terrible, but when playing solo there is little incentive when the gates are open to actually help others (easy to get one pip, and have to do a lot more for two). The game is definitely more enjoyable as a group of survivors but the killer is a lot of fun too (solo play). Perks are decently diverse and are continouesly being balanced (e.g. no one escapes death) but there are some clear cookie cutter perks if you can obtain them from the blood webs, espeically when all teachables are unlocked.  The killers are reasonably balanced and all have their own nich√©. However, current game (05/08/2016) the wraith obtains points are a faster rate/easier and there is some problems with "nice/meme/friendly etc." wraiths who don't actually try to kill anyone.

With all this being said, the game is very addictive and you will find yourself coming back to play even after frustrating games. There is a lot of replayability and depending on your opinion on prestige systems, there are non-game changing appearance alterations.
